definitions: Vibrations that travel through the air or another medium and can be heard when they reach a person's or animal's ear.
A thing that can be heard.
The area or distance within which something can be heard.
Sound produced by continuous and regular vibrations, as opposed to noise.
Music, speech, and sound effects when recorded and used to accompany a film, video, or broadcast.
Broadcasting by radio as distinct from television.
The distinctive quality of the music of a particular composer or performer or of the sound produced by a particular instrument.
An idea or impression conveyed by words.
